newsitem.title: USA: Armor Holdings converts subordinated notes.
newsitem.headline: Armor Holdings converts subordinated notes.

text.p: Armor Holdings Inc said on Thursday it converted its $11.5 million 5 percent convertible subordinated notes due 2001 into common stock at $5 per share.
The company said it issued 2.3 million fully registered common shares and eliminated $11.5 million of long term debt.

"The conversion of these notes substantially strengthens our balance sheet enabling us to aggressively pursue strategic acquisitions in our core markets," said Jonathan Spiller, president and chief executive officer. He said the company's balance sheet was virtually debt free.
Armor Holdings makes and distributes products and services for the law enforcement, military and security markets.
